head.title: Guidance Document: Taking Privacy into Account Before Making Contracting Decisions - Canada.ca

meta.name: dc.title
meta.content: Guidance Document: Taking Privacy into Account Before Making Contracting Decisions

meta.name: gc.description.Long
meta.content: This guidance document is intended to provide advice to federal government institutions whenever they consider contracting out activities in which personal information about Canadians is handled or accessed by private sector agencies under contract. The document was developed in response to privacy risks associated with the potential exposure of Canadians' personal information to U.S. authorities under the USA PATRIOT Act.

main.h1: Guidance Document: Taking Privacy into Account Before Making Contracting Decisions

div.div: This guidance document is intended to provide advice to federal government institutions whenever they consider contracting out activities in which personal information about Canadians is handled or accessed by private sector agencies under contract. The document was developed in response to privacy risks associated with the potential exposure of Canadians' personal information to U.S. authorities under the USA PATRIOT Act.

img.alt: Privacy Protection, Policy on is collapsed. Click to expand.
Privacy Protection, Policy on is expanded. Click to collapse.

a.strong: Guidance Document: Taking Privacy into Account Before Making Contracting Decisions

div.a: Report a problem or mistake on this page

aside.h2: Government of Canada activities and initiatives

p.a: Access Government of Canada activities and initiatives

object.aria-label: Symbol of the Government of Canada

body.script: GLOSSARY.Terms = [{"id":10459,"definition":"Is a privacy impact assessment that involves more than one government institution. (See definition of privacy impact assessment, below.)","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"multi-institutional privacy impact assessments","nameTranslation":"évaluations des facteurs relatifs à la vie privée multi-institutionnelles"},{"id":10470,"definition":"Is a number suitable for use as a file number or account number or for data-processing purposes, as defined in subsection 138(3) of the \u003cem\u003eEmployment Insurance Act\u003c/em\u003e. For purposes of paragraph 3(c) of the \u003cem\u003ePrivacy Act\u003c/em\u003e, the SIN is an identifying number, and is therefore considered to be personal information.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"Social Insurance Number (SIN)","nameTranslation":"numéro d\u0027assurance sociale (NAS"},{"id":10461,"definition":"Is the use of personal information for a purpose that is not related to any decision-making process that directly affects the individual. This includes the use of personal information for research, statistical, audit and evaluation purposes.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"non-administrative purpose","nameTranslation":"fins non-administratives"},{"id":10463,"definition":"Is a description of personal information that is organized and retrievable by a person\u0027s name or by an identifying number, symbol or other particular assigned only to that person. The personal information described in the personal information bank has been used, is being used, or is available for an administrative purpose and is under the control of a government institution.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"personal information bank","nameTranslation":"fichier de renseignements personnels"},{"id":10464,"definition":"Is a policy process for identifying, assessing and mitigating privacy risks. Government institutions are to develop and maintain privacy impact assessments for all new or modified programs and activities that involve the use of personal information for an administrative purpose.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"privacy impact assessment","nameTranslation":"évaluation des facteurs relatifs à la vie privée"},{"id":10445,"definition":"Is the use of personal information about an individual \"in a decision making process that directly affects that individual\" (section 3). This includes all uses of personal information for confirming identity (i.e. authentication and verification purposes) and for determining eligibility of individuals for government programs.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"administrative purpose","nameTranslation":"fins administratives"},{"id":10455,"definition":"Is \"any department or ministry of state of the Government of Canada, or any body or office, listed in the schedule; and, any parent Crown corporation, and any wholly-owned subsidiary of such a corporation, within the meaning of section 83 of the \u003cem\u003eFinancial Administration Act\u003c/em\u003e\" (section 3). The term \"government institution\" does not include Ministers\u0027 Offices.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"government institution","nameTranslation":"institution fédérale"},{"id":10458,"definition":"Is a notice issued by Treasury Board Secretariat to provide guidance on the interpretation and application of the \u003cem\u003ePrivacy Act\u003c/em\u003e and its related policy, directives, standards and guidelines.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"Implementation report","nameTranslation":"rapport de mise en oeuvre"},{"id":10452,"definition":"Is the information to which the Act does not apply as described in sections 69, 69.1, 70 and 70.1.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"excluded information","nameTranslation":"renseignements exclus"},{"id":10462,"definition":"Is \"information about an identifiable individual that is recorded in any form\" (section 3). See section 3 of the Act for additional information.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"personal information","nameTranslation":"renseignements personnels"},{"id":10465,"definition":"Is an Officer of Parliament appointed by Governor in Council.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"Privacy Commissioner","nameTranslation":"Commissaire à la protection de la vie privée"},{"id":10451,"definition":"Is a person who is designated as the Minister under subsection 3.1(1). For the purposes of this policy, the designated minister is the President of the Treasury Board.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"designated minister","nameTranslation":"ministre désigné"},{"id":10468,"definition":"Is, for the purposes of the appropriate collection, use or disclosure of personal information by government institutions subject to this policy, a program or activity that is authorized or approved by Parliament. Parliamentary authority is usually contained in an Act of Parliament or subsequent Regulations. Parliamentary authority can also be in the form of approval of expenditures proposed in the Estimates and as authorized by an appropriation Act. Also included in this definition are any activities conducted as part of the administration of the program.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"program or activity","nameTranslation":"programme ou activité"},{"id":10460,"definition":"Is a consistent use that was not originally identified in the appropriate Personal Information Bank (PIB) description in the government institution\u0027s chapter in \u003cem\u003eInfo Source\u003c/em\u003e.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"new consistent use","nameTranslation":"nouvel usage compatible"},{"id":10471,"definition":"Is intended to provide up-to-date statistics on the operation of the legislation. The reports allow the government to monitor trends and to respond to enquiries from Members of Parliament, the public and the media. The reports also form the statistical portion of government institutions annual reports to Parliament. The forms used for preparing the report are prescribed by the designated minister, as provided under paragraphs 71(1)(c) and (e) of the \u003cem\u003ePrivacy Act\u003c/em\u003e.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"statistical report","nameTranslation":"rapport statistique"},{"id":10467,"definition":"Is a request for access to personal information under the Act.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"privacy request","nameTranslation":"demande de renseignements personnels"},{"id":10448,"definition":"Is a use that has a reasonable and direct connection to the original purpose(s) for which the information was obtained or compiled. This means that the original purpose and the proposed purpose are so closely related that the individual would expect that the information would be used for the consistent purpose, even if the use is not spelled out.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"consistent use","nameTranslation":"usage compatible"},{"id":10446,"definition":"Is a report submitted by the head of a government institution to Parliament on the administration of the Act during the financial year.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"annual report","nameTranslation":"rapport annuel"},{"id":10449,"definition":"Is an activity involving the comparison of personal information from different sources, including sources within the same government institution, for administrative or non-administrative purposes. The data-matching activity that is established can be systematic or recurring. The data-matching activity can also be conducted on a periodic basis when deemed necessary. Under this policy, data matching includes the disclosure or sharing of personal information with another organization for data-matching purposes.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"data matching","nameTranslation":"couplage des données"},{"id":10447,"definition":"Is an individual who files a complaint with the Privacy Commissioner on any of the grounds set out in subsection 29(1) of the Act.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"complainant","nameTranslation":"plaignant(e"},{"id":10453,"definition":"Is a personal information bank that describes files, all of which consist predominantly of personal information that relates to international affairs, defence, law enforcement and investigation, as outlined in sections 21 and 22 of the Act. The head of a government institution can refuse to disclose any personal information requested that is contained in an exempt bank.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"exempt bank","nameTranslation":"fichier inconsultable"},{"id":10457,"definition":"Is a series of annual Treasury Board Secretariat publications in which government institutions are required to describe their institutions, program responsibilities and information holdings, including PIBs and classes of personal information. The descriptions are to contain sufficient clarity and detail to facilitate the exercise of the right of access under the \u003cem\u003ePrivacy Act\u003c/em\u003e. Data-matching activities, use of the SIN and all activities for which privacy impact assessments were conducted have to be cited in \u003cem\u003eInfo Source\u003c/em\u003e PIBs, as applicable. The \u003cem\u003eInfo Source\u003c/em\u003e publications also provide contact information for government institutions as well as summaries of court cases and statistics on access requests.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"Info Source","nameTranslation":"Info Source"},{"id":10454,"definition":"Is a mandatory or discretionary provision under the Act that authorizes the head of the government institution to refuse to disclose information in response to a request received under the Act.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"exemption","nameTranslation":"exception"},{"id":10469,"definition":"Is a person who is requesting access to personal information about himself or herself or who has requested that a correction be made or a notation attached to his or her personal information.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"requestor","nameTranslation":"requérant"},{"id":10450,"definition":"Is an officer or employee of a government institution who has been delegated to exercise or perform the powers, duties and functions of the head of the institution under the Act.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"delegate","nameTranslation":"délégué"},{"id":10456,"definition":"Is the Minister, in the case of a department or ministry of state. In any other case, it is the person designated by the \u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/SI-83-114\"\u003ePrivacy Act Heads of Government Institutions Designation Order\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e. If no such person is designated, the chief executive officer of the government institution, whatever their title, is the head.","instrumentId":12510,"instrumentTitle":"Privacy Protection, Policy on","name":"head","nameTranslation":"responsable"}]
